intro: Dianthus nezahatiae, commonly known as the Nezahatiae Campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant produces vibrant pink to red flowers with five petals, often arranged in a cup-like shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or alpine settings. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
